intro: Mammillaria eriantha, commonly known as the white-tipped hedgehog cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice among cactus enthusiasts.
